pwa.util

Class CmdWinController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pwa.util.CmdWinController

  • public class CmdWinController
extends java.lang.Object

    Personal Web Application (PWA) Command Window Controller

    Start and Close

    Use startCommandWindow and closeCommandWindow method.

    Execute a command

    Use executeCommand method.

    Execute a command and get results

     
	cmdWin.setLogFlag(true); 
	cmdWin.executeCommand("dir");
	List<String>results = cmdWin.getCommandResult();
	cmdWin.setLogFlag(false);

    After calling executeCommand method, you may need to wait until the command execution is done. You can check if the command is finished or not with CmdCompletionChecker object.

    See Also:
    CmdCompletionChecker

      • getLastLogContents

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLastLogContents(int numOfLines)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the last log content with specified number of lines. The log file is the one with prefixed. e.g. if the specified number of lines is 10, then it should returns the last 10 lines of the last or latest log files with the specified prefix, which has been set.
        Parameters:
        numOfLines - the number of lines of from the last log
        Returns:
        the specified number of lines of the last log content.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

        tempFilePrefix - temporary file prefix

        command results

      • setPrintFlag

        public void setPrintFlag(boolean val)
        Set true if you want to display command IO result on the console. You must set false if this object is used in web server-side processing.
        Parameters:
        val - true or false

      • setWaitSeconds

        public void setWaitSeconds(int val)
        Set duration before getting the command result. The duration is used in getCommandResult method.
        Parameters:
        val - in seconds
